Name: Zagreb
Description: Zagreb is the capital and largest city of Croatia, known for its historical architecture, vibrant cultural scene, and as the political, economic, and educational center of the country.

Name: Split-Dalmatia
Description: Split-Dalmatia is a coastal region known for its Mediterranean climate, beautiful beaches, and the city of Split, which is famous for its historical landmarks, including Diocletian s Palace.

Name: Dubrovnik-Neretva
Description: Dubrovnik-Neretva is known for its UNESCO-listed city of Dubrovnik, stunning coastal scenery, and historical sites along the Adriatic Sea.

Name: Istria
Description: Istria is a peninsula region in the Adriatic Sea, famous for its picturesque coastline, medieval towns, olive oil production, and being a popular tourist destination.

Name: Primorje-Gorski Kotar
Description: Primorje-Gorski Kotar is a region located on the coast of the Adriatic Sea, known for its natural beauty, including the Risnjak National Park and the city of Rijeka.

Name: Osijek-Baranja
Description: Osijek-Baranja is an inland region in eastern Croatia, known for its agricultural lands, vineyards, and the city of Osijek, which is rich in history and culture.

Name: Varaždin
Description: Varaždin is a northern region of Croatia, known for its baroque architecture, historical landmarks, and being a hub for culture and festivals.

Name: Zadar
Description: Zadar is a coastal region famous for its historical old town, Roman ruins, and beautiful coastline. It is a popular tourist destination along the Adriatic.
